Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 7 wickets (with 46 balls remaining).
Pre-Game Insights: PNG gave West Indies a near-scare in their opening game and will hope to go one better against a demoralised New Zealand side.
Trent Boult confirmed this will be his last T20 World Cup.
New Zealand look to end with a bang as they have only three players under 30 in their side.
Kane Williamson believes it may not be the end of the road yet for many seniors, but New Zealand bowing out of the tournament early will make them rethink the future.
Papua New Guinea's spinners bowled superbly in their game against West Indies.
Alei Nao has been excellent for PNG with the new ball and has taken a wicket in the powerplay in all three games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitches at the Brian Lara Stadium have not been too conducive to batting. The fast bowlers have had a bit of help with the new ball, while the spinners have found some turn.
It is expected to be partly cloudy in the morning, and thunderstorms can be expected in spots throughout the day.
New Zealand have the best economy rate of 4.22 in the powerplay in the T20 World Cup 2024.
PNG have scored at a run rate of 5.22 this tournament, the third-lowest behind Uganda and Sri Lanka.
New Zealand have the second-lowest batting average (12.60) among Full Member nations at this T20 World Cup behind Ireland.
